Description of incident: A laptop was stolen from the trunk              of a car. It contained information about heart disease patients, including              their names, dates of birth and diagnoses of their medical conditions.               UPDATE (4/14/08):              Ongoing review of the computer's last-known contents, performed on              data backed up from the laptop before it was stolen, has found a file              that, unbeknownst to the lead researcher, had been loaded onto the              laptop by a research associate.That file included Social Security              numbers for at least 1,281 of the 3,078 patients enrolled in the multi-year              study, which is sponsored by the NIH's National Heart, Lung and Blood              Institute.
